title: Medical Cost Disputes to Be Settled by Arbitrator
sub_head: The Biden administration issued second of two rules under the No Surprise Act aimed at limiting out-of-pocket medical costs
body:
Health insurers and medical providers who canâ€™t agree on the cost of a treatment or service will soon be settling their differences through an independent resolution system that will render decisions that shape billions of dollars in healthcare spending.
The Biden administration on Thursday issued an interim final rule establishing the architectural structure of the arbitration process, following years of lobbying by hospitals and insurers, and legislative wrangling over how to hammer out disputes over patient charges while protecting consumers from unexpected, large medical bills.
